item.heading: A European holiday for every kind of traveller
item.description: Europe is the perfect holiday destination, luring travellers from across the world with its old-world charm, gastronomic delights, historic monuments and various cultural festivals.

item.heading: 5 Steps to creating a Holiday Fund
item.description: Taking a holiday can mean different things to different people. For some, it is a much needed break from a hectic work schedule while for others it might be an annual family tradition.

item.heading: Guide to buying a retirement home
item.description: Traditionally, in India, retirement meant a time of your life when your kids would take care of you.

item.heading: Experiences can be priceless
item.description: We live in a world that is obsessed with consumption. Everybody is in a race to buy something.

item.heading: Projects you can pursue in retirement
item.description: For a long time, retirement has been considered a time to turn off the alarm clocks and hang up your boots.

item.heading: Create a Retirement Fund that gives you comfort in
item.description: Retirement is a time for you to sit back and relax. A time to pursue your pet project and be free of the stresses of your work life.

item.heading: Create a budget with your spouse
item.description: Budgeting does not come easily to most of us. We live in a world of instant gratification where saving has lost much of its previous appeal. The challenges with budgeting get amplified in a marriage.

item.heading: Buying Vs Renting – A debate that is heating up
item.description: Any conversation that ponders over the “buying vs renting” conundrum is likely to end up in a raging debate with the proponents of each passionately defending their corner.

item.heading: Don’t let your EMI become a burden
item.description: Living in our own home is something that most of us hope to accomplish in our lifetime. While a majority of home buyers use a home loan to finance their purchase

item.heading: Roti, Kapda aur Makaan – What does housing mean fo
item.description: In Indian society, home ownership is symbolic of stability and success. “Buying a house” is a goal for a majority of Indians as owning a house serves to be as much of a status symbol as a necessity.
Marriage is varyingly described as a union between two kindred spirits, an equal partnership or sometimes, even a merger.
